section.title: Elver Persistency moves to Eclipse.org as Teneo within EMFT

p.strong: Elver persistency is in the process of moving to eclipse.org. Elver persistency will be continued as the Teneo project in the EMFT project. The current status:

ul.li: The source code has been moved to Eclipse cvs. The new main java package name: org.eclipse.emf.teneo.
Currently we are working on the build process.
Support is given on both the EMFT newsgroup as the Elver mailinglist. When the build process at eclipse.org is operational, support will move completely to the EMFT newsgroup.

section.title: EMF Persistency Solution using JDO/JPOX
section.p: The EMF - JPOX integration supports all EMF and JDO 2.0/JPOX features. EMF objects can be persisted in most major relational databases and retrieved using an EMF resource approach or advanced JDOQL queries.

p.strong: Current version: 0.7.2 ALPHA (last updated on 7 June 2006) for Eclipse 3.2*/EMF 2.2*/JPOX 1.1rc1 and jdk 1.4 and later, Status, Features, Change Log

p.em: The mapping logic has been completely rewritten in this version, please read the Change Log.

p.strong: Releases are not guaranteed to be backward compatible. Before upgrading first read the Change Log and Upgrading pages.

p.em: For troubleshooting please visit the Known Issues and Troubleshooting pages.

section.p: *This release should also work for Eclipse 3.1/EMF 2.1, however only limited testing has been done.

section.title: JPOX
section.p: The EMF - JDO/JPOX integration is a layer over the JPOX 1.1.0 (JDO 2.0) product. JPOX is the reference implementation for JDO 2.0. The jpox website has excellent documentation. Please visit JPOX at http://www.jpox.org.

section.title: EMF
section.p: The Eclipse Modeling Framwork (EMF) is a modeling and code generation framework which generates source code from different sources: an UML diagram or a XML Schema. For more information see here.
